author: jochembrouwer
content:
I opened a PR: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/364 

But I'm gonna need some basic help with how to run the linter for instance (I want to `tox -e tests`)

author: danceratopz
content:
Hey Jochem, do you use VS Code or familiar with it, at least? We have some bundled Code settings and recommended plugins (.vscode/extensions.json) included in the repo which have some helpful settings. If you rename the settings file as documented (see link below) and restart code, it will then prompt you to install the recommended extensions.

After this setup, upon saving your file in VS Code, it will be auto-formatted in the required ("black") format and your module imports will be sorted as required by `isort` (the current reason why `tox` is failing in your PR).

Additionally, the linter will highlight any other problems.

Typing/typehints (getting `mypy` to run cleanly) can be trickier, I'm happy to help there if there's any issues!

Could you try to setup Code as described here and see if that helps?
https://ethereum.github.io/execution-spec-tests/main/getting_started/setup_vs_code/

author: danceratopz
content:
The `--evm-dump-dir` flag might also be helpful to gain more insight as to how `t8n` is being called and checking output and traces, for example:
https://ethereum.github.io/execution-spec-tests/main/getting_started/debugging_t8n_tools/#evm-dump-directory

author: jochembrouwer
content: Great, this helps a lot, thanks!
